data.title: Miss South Africa xenophobia row deepens with identity fraud claim
data.meta_description: Chidimma Adetshina has faced online abuse since rumours swirled that she was Nigerian – now government ministers say her mother may have used someone else’s name
data.text:
A row over xenophobia in the “Rainbow Nation” intensified yesterday with the government investigating the background and citizenship of a Miss South Africa contestant.

Chidimma Adetshina, 23, has been the target of abuse on social media for weeks, since rumours swirled online that she was Nigerian, not South African. Detractors say she should not be allowed to compete in the beauty pageant’s finale on Saturday.

After beginning an investigation on Tuesday, South Africa’s home affairs department said late on Wednesday that Adetshina’s mother may have committed identity theft, and assumed the name of an “innocent South African mother” around the time of her daughter’s birth.

The law student has a Nigerian father and name, but was born and raised in Johannesburg. She says her mother
